level.heading: Requirements for administration of grant programs.
level.text: A grantor administering a grant program covered by this part shall:
Within 30 days from the closing date of the grant application process, provide notification to all applicants of the acceptance or rejection of their applications for the grant funds; and

Maintain records of any written communications as well as a description of any other communications, including telephonic or face-to-face communications, between the grantor and any District government official or staff regarding:
The development of the selection criteria or eligibility requirements;
Selection by the grantor of a grantee; or
Issues with a grantee's compliance with grant-program requirements.
Records required under this paragraph shall be provided, upon request, within a reasonable time, to the Mayor, or his or her designee, or to a member of the Council.

level.heading: Emergency Legislation
level.text: For temporary (90 days) addition of this section, see § 1095 of the Fiscal Year 2014 Budget Support Emergency Act of 2013 (D.C. Act 20-130, July 30, 2013, 60 DCR 11384, 20 DCSTAT 1827).

level.heading: Short Title
level.text: Section 1091 of D.C. Law 20-61 provided that Subtitle J of Title I of the act may be cited as the "Grant Administration Act of 2013".

level.heading: Editor’s Notes
level.text: Applicability of D.C. Law 20-61: Section 11001 of D.C. Law 20-61 provided that, except as otherwise provided, the act shall apply as of October 1, 2013.
